lead_paragraph: The authorities used a “total containment vessel” to haul the device to the Bronx before passing it along to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, Adam Goldman, Scott Shane and Michael Wilson.

headline.print_headline: Police Dragnet Turns Up a Clue, and a Fortified Sphere Hauls It Away
headline.main: How Police Found Second Bomb, and a ‘Total Containment Vessel’ Hauled It Away

snippet: The authorities used a “total containment vessel” to haul the device to the Bronx before passing it along to the Federal Bureau of Investigation....
abstract: New York City police officers investigating Chelsea bombing find second unexploded bomb on West 27th Street and transport it to the Bronx using 'total containment vessel', or chamber capable of containing blast of 25 pounds of TNT or more, before passing it on to FBI.
